definition:
The *profinite completion* of a group $G$ is defined to be the profinite
group
$$\hat{G} = \varprojlim_{N {\trianglelefteqslant_{\mathrm{f}}}G} G/N,$$
where $N {\trianglelefteqslant_{\mathrm{f}}}G$ means that $N$ is a
normal subgroup of finite index in $G$.

A group embeds into its profinite completion if and only if it is
residually finite.
